timeline.bodyText:
This is concerning, I didn't consider the fact that SMP chars would be problematic and the exact problem isn't specified.
I might need to perform a 2-way mapping, but it'd be good to get a concrete example of the issue.
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: You might look to the git blame / history on this one - I thought the same thing as I read this. I wonder if it is a problem anymore? I mean, when AnkiDroid first started it was API1, and now the WebView is Chrome, so...could be this should either be deleted already or sunsetted with a Compat implementation and an API cutoff where we know it's okay (and I'd think any API number that has access to current Chrome WebView at least would be okay, if this was just a historical thing)
replies.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText:
Anki desktop fails to handle SMP characters.
But, the Visual Editor without the code seems to display it without problems 𓀇.
replies.author: david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText: Mind if I extract this pattern into a local variable?
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: I'm more interested in whether we need it or could Compat-sunset it. A local variable used once is not interesting to me it is actually hard to read because you have to find the reference
replies.author: mikehardy

timeline.message:
Extract BrowserAppearance and delete abstractions

Mostly for use in the Visual Editor

Delete ReviewerExtRegistry and implementations - only contained one
class

REVIEW: Deprecate convertSmpToHtmlEntity

This code existed before auto-updating WebViews, and appears
unnecessary.

We gate the feature to < API 21 to determine if it's still required.
